description: Perhaps from a nasalised variant of Scots begeck (“to deceive, disappoint”), equivalent to be- +‎ geck.

entries.meaning: (dialectal, chiefly Scotland) An illusion; trick; cheat.

verbs.description: begunk (third-person singular simple present begunks, present participle begunking, simple past and past participle begunked)

entries.meaning: (transitive, dialectal, chiefly Scotland) To befool; deceive; balk; jilt.
